issue.title: [C++] Ensure Arrow can use OpenTelmetry from conda-forge
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-15066](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15066). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
OpenTelemetry was just merged into conda-forge (see <https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/commit/6a21350616b5ca6248dcfffe35e902634ab7c2ae>), once packages exist we should ensure Arrow can use those packages to save some build effort.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15066?focusedCommentId=17459489) by David Li (lidavidm):*
In <https://github.com/conda-forge/cpp-opentelemetry-sdk-feedstock/pull/3> I am enabling the otlp-http exporter after which everything should 'just work'

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15066?focusedCommentId=17505120) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
Issue resolved by pull request 11963
